head.title: Colorado Rockies at Arizona Diamondbacks Box Score, March 29, 2018 | Baseball-Reference.com

meta.name: Description
meta.content: Arizona Diamondbacks beat Colorado Rockies (8-2). Mar 29, 2018, Attendance: 48703, Time of Game: 3:36. Visit Baseball-Reference.com for the complete box score, play-by-play, and win probability
Colorado Rockies at Arizona Diamondbacks Box Score, March 29, 2018 | Baseball-Reference.com
Arizona Diamondbacks beat Colorado Rockies (8-2). Mar 29, 2018, Attendance: 48703, Time of Game: 3:36. Visit Baseball-Reference.com for the complete box score, play-by-play, and win probability

th.aria-label: Plate Appearances
th.data-tip:
Plate Appearances
When available, we use actual plate appearances from play-by-play game accounts
Otherwise estimated using AB + BB + HBP + SF + SH,
which excludes catcher interferences.
When this color click for a summary of each PA.

th.aria-label: Batting Average
th.data-tip:
Hits/At Bats
For recent years, leaders need 3.1 PA
per team game played
Bold indicates highest BA using current stats
Gold means awarded title at end of year.

(H + BB + HBP)/(At Bats + BB + HBP + SF)
For recent years, leaders need 3.1 PA
per team game played

th.aria-label: Slugging %
th.data-tip:
Total Bases/At Bats or
(1B + 2*2B + 3*3B + 4*HR)/AB
For recent years, leaders need 3.1 PA
per team game played

th.aria-label: On-Base Plus Slugging
th.data-tip:
On-Base + Slugging Percentages
For recent years, leaders need 3.1 PA
per team game played

Number of pitches in the PA.
Click to see the pitch-by-pitch sequence.

th.aria-label: Strikes Includes both pitches in the zone and those swung at out of the zone.
th.data-tip:
Strikes
Includes both pitches in the zone and those swung at out of the zone.

th.aria-label: Win Probability Added (WPA)
th.data-tip:
Win Probability Added for Offensive Player
Given average teams, this is the change in probability
caused by this batter during the game
A change of +/- 1 would indicate one win added or lost.

th.aria-label: Average Leverage Index The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season. 1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.
th.data-tip:
Average Leverage Index
The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season.
1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.
th.data-name:
Average Leverage Index
The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season.
1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.

th.aria-label: Win Probability Added Sum of positive events for this batter.
th.data-tip:
Win Probability Added
Sum of positive events for this batter.
th.data-name:
Win Probability Added
Sum of positive events for this batter.

th.aria-label: Win Probability Subtracted Sum of negative events for this batter.
th.data-tip:
Win Probability Subtracted
Sum of negative events for this batter.
th.data-name:
Win Probability Subtracted
Sum of negative events for this batter.

th.aria-label: Base-Out Runs Added (RE24)
th.data-tip:
Base-Out Runs Added
Given the bases occupied/out situation, how many runs did the batter
or baserunner add in the resulting play.
Compared to average, so 0 is average, and above 0 is better than average

div.div: HR: DJ LeMahieu (1, off Patrick Corbin, 1st inn, 0 on, 1 out to Deep LF); Nolan Arenado (1, off Patrick Corbin, 6th inn, 0 on, 0 outs to Deep LF-CF).
SH: Jon Gray (1, off Patrick Corbin).
TB: Nolan Arenado 5; DJ LeMahieu 4; Chris Iannetta 3; Gerardo Parra; Ian Desmond; Trevor Story.

div.div: 2B: Jake Lamb (1, off Jon Gray); Nick Ahmed (1, off Mike Dunn).
TB: Jarrod Dyson 4; Jake Lamb 3; David Peralta 3; Nick Ahmed 2; Ketel Marte; Deven Marrero; Alex Avila; A.J. Pollock.
RBI: Jake Lamb 4 (4); Alex Avila (1); Jarrod Dyson (1); Deven Marrero (1); David Peralta (1).
DP: 2. Ketel Marte-Nick Ahmed-Paul Goldschmidt; Nick Ahmed-Deven Marrero-Paul Goldschmidt.
SB: David Peralta (1, 2nd base off Scott Oberg/Chris Iannetta); Jarrod Dyson (1, 3rd base off Scott Oberg/Chris Iannetta).

th.aria-label: Unknown batted ball type A ball in play for which we don’t know the type.
th.data-tip:
Unknown batted ball type
A ball in play for which we don’t know the type.

th.aria-label: Game Score Developed by Bill James 1. Start with 50 points. 2. Add 1 point for each out recorded, so 3 points for every complete inning pitched. 3. Add 2 points for each inning completed after the 4th. 4. Add 1 point for each strikeout. 5. Subtract 2 points for each hit allowed. 6. Subtract 4 points for each earned run allowed. 7. Subtract 2 points for each unearned run allowed. 8. Subtract 1 point for each walk.
th.data-tip:
Game Score
Developed by Bill James
1. Start with 50 points.
2. Add 1 point for each out recorded, so 3 points for every complete inning pitched.
3. Add 2 points for each inning completed after the 4th.
4. Add 1 point for each strikeout.
5. Subtract 2 points for each hit allowed.
6. Subtract 4 points for each earned run allowed.
7. Subtract 2 points for each unearned run allowed.
8. Subtract 1 point for each walk.

th.aria-label: Inherited Runners Number of runners on base when pitcher entered the game.
th.data-tip:
Inherited Runners
Number of runners on base when pitcher entered the game.

th.aria-label: Inherited Score Number or percentage of runners on base when pitcher entered the game who subsequently scored. These runners show up in the previous pitcher’s ERA.
th.data-tip:
Inherited Score
Number or percentage of runners on base when pitcher entered the game who subsequently scored.
These runners show up in the previous pitcher’s ERA.

th.aria-label: Win Probability Added (WPA)
th.data-tip:
Win Probability Added by Pitcher
Given average teams, this is the change in probability
A change of +/- 1 would indicate one win added or lost.

th.aria-label: Average Leverage Index The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season. 1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.
th.data-tip:
Average Leverage Index
The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season.
1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.
th.data-name:
Average Leverage Index
The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season.
1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.

th.aria-label: Base-Out Runs Saved (RE24)
th.data-tip:
Base-Out Runs Saved
Given the bases occupied/out situation, how many runs did the pitcher
save in the resulting play. Compared to average, so 0 is average, and
above 0 is better than average

div.p: Jon Gray faced 3 batters in the 5th inning.

th.data-tip:
Unknown batted ball type
A ball in play for which we don’t know the type.

th.aria-label: Game Score Developed by Bill James 1. Start with 50 points. 2. Add 1 point for each out recorded, so 3 points for every complete inning pitched. 3. Add 2 points for each inning completed after the 4th. 4. Add 1 point for each strikeout. 5. Subtract 2 points for each hit allowed. 6. Subtract 4 points for each earned run allowed. 7. Subtract 2 points for each unearned run allowed. 8. Subtract 1 point for each walk.
th.data-tip:
Game Score
Developed by Bill James
1. Start with 50 points.
2. Add 1 point for each out recorded, so 3 points for every complete inning pitched.
3. Add 2 points for each inning completed after the 4th.
4. Add 1 point for each strikeout.
5. Subtract 2 points for each hit allowed.
6. Subtract 4 points for each earned run allowed.
7. Subtract 2 points for each unearned run allowed.
8. Subtract 1 point for each walk.

th.aria-label: Inherited Runners Number of runners on base when pitcher entered the game.
th.data-tip:
Inherited Runners
Number of runners on base when pitcher entered the game.

th.aria-label: Inherited Score Number or percentage of runners on base when pitcher entered the game who subsequently scored. These runners show up in the previous pitcher’s ERA.
th.data-tip:
Inherited Score
Number or percentage of runners on base when pitcher entered the game who subsequently scored.
These runners show up in the previous pitcher’s ERA.

th.aria-label: Win Probability Added (WPA)
th.data-tip:
Win Probability Added by Pitcher
Given average teams, this is the change in probability
A change of +/- 1 would indicate one win added or lost.

th.aria-label: Average Leverage Index The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season. 1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.
th.data-tip:
Average Leverage Index
The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season.
1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.
th.data-name:
Average Leverage Index
The average pressure the pitcher or batter saw in this game or season.
1.0 is average pressure, below 1.0 is low pressure and above 1.0 is high pressure.

th.aria-label: Base-Out Runs Saved (RE24)
th.data-tip:
Base-Out Runs Saved
Given the bases occupied/out situation, how many runs did the pitcher
save in the resulting play. Compared to average, so 0 is average, and
above 0 is better than average

div.p: Andrew Chafin faced 1 batter in the 7th inning.

th.aria-label: Pitches (Balls-Strikes) Pitches Seen in PA with abbreviations Click to see the non-abbreviated pitch-by-pitch sequence C --called strike S --swinging strike F --foul B --ball X --ball put into play by batter T --foul tip K --strike (unknown type) I --intentional ball H --hit batter L --foul bunt M --missed bunt attempt N --no pitch (on balks and interference calls) O --foul tip on bunt P --pitchout Q --swinging on pitchout R --foul ball on pitchout U --unknown or missed pitch V --called ball because pitcher went to his mouth Y --ball put into play on pitchout 1 --pickoff throw to first 2 --pickoff throw to second 3 --pickoff throw to third > --Indicates a runner going on the pitch + --following pickoff throw by the catcher * --indicates the following pitch was blocked by the catcher. . --marker for play not involving the batter
th.data-tip:
Pitches (Balls-Strikes)
Pitches Seen in PA with abbreviations
Click to see the non-abbreviated pitch-by-pitch sequence
C--called strike
S--swinging strike
F--foul
B--ball
X--ball put into play by batter

T--foul tip
K--strike (unknown type)
I--intentional ball
H--hit batter
L--foul bunt
M--missed bunt attempt
N--no pitch (on balks and interference calls)
O--foul tip on bunt
P--pitchout
Q--swinging on pitchout
R--foul ball on pitchout
U--unknown or missed pitch
V--called ball because pitcher went to his mouth
Y--ball put into play on pitchout
1--pickoff throw to first
2--pickoff throw to second
3--pickoff throw to third
>--Indicates a runner going on the pitch
+--following pickoff throw by the catcher
*--indicates the following pitch was blocked by the catcher.
.--marker for play not involving the batter

a.name: explain
a.li: Score- The score from the perspective of the batting team.

RoB- This gives the baserunner (Runners on Base) configuration at the start of the play. "1-3" would mean runners on first and third. Clicking on this will show the defensive players and baserunners on the field for this play.

Pit- When available, the number of pitches in this plate appearance. Clicking on this number will show the sequence of pitches thrown including, when available, things like runner going, ball blocked, attempted pickoffs and the like. We believe this data to be as accurate as humanly possible, but there are going to be some errors in the data, so please take it with a grain of salt. Clicking on this will show the defensive players and baserunners on the field for this play.
R/O- This has a "O" for every out on the play and an "R" for every run that scored on the play. Some plays will have both in no particular order.
Batter- The batter at the plate when this play occurred. If the play is a baserunning event, then the batter's name will be repeated as indicated by quotes.
Pitcher- The pitcher on the mound when this play occurred.

li.a: wWPA- Winning Team's Win Probability Added. The amount that this play increased or decreased the eventual winning team's probability of winning the game.

ul.li: wWE- Winning Team's Win Expectancy. The probability of the eventual winning team winning the game at the end of this play given two average teams playing each other. More About Win Probability Added

Play Detail- This is an explanation of the play that occurred. In some cases, batted ball location and type will be indicated within parentheses. Again, these are best efforts to the record the game as it happened. Also, plays made on the baserunners (including the batter as a baserunner) will be indicated in parentheses after the baserunner's name. Advancement of baserunners is given in cases where the advancement is not easily deduced or obvious from the play. For example, advancement for a walk will not be given, but for a single or double it will be given.

div.p: Please report any issues or strangeness you see with the description of plays given above. We have tested several hundred different types of plays, but, in all likelihood, there are still some errors or misinterpretations of the play-by-play data.

In some cases, the results from play-by-play data will contradict results in the official record. The official record has many, many errors, but we have not undertaken to reconcile those errors. Pitch-by-pitch data should not be taken as completely accurate, though we believe it to be as accurate as is currently possible.
Box scores and play-by-play outputs produced by Sports Reference LLC. All Rights Reserved.

'non-blocking':'blocking')); ga('sr_tracker.send', 'pageview'); /* cribbed from: http://www.axllent.org/docs/view/track-outbound-links-with-analytics-js/ */ function _gaLt(event) { if (!ga.hasOwnProperty("loaded") || ga.loaded != true) { return; } var el = event.srcElement || event.target; /* if a link has been clicked */ if (el && el.href) { var link = el.href; /* Only if it is an external link */ if (link.indexOf(location.host) == -1 && !link.match(/^javascript\:/i)) { /* Is target set and not _(self|parent|top)? */ var target = (el.target && !el.target.match(/^_(self|parent|top)/i)) ? el.target : false; /* If target opens a new window then just track */ if (el.target && !el.target.match(/^_(self|parent|top)/i)) { ga("send", "event", "Outgoing Links", link, document.location.pathname + document.location.search); } }; } } window.addEventListener ? window.addEventListener("load", function() { document.body.addEventListener("click", _gaLt, !1)}, !1) : window.attachEvent && window.attachEvent("onload", function() { document.body.attachEvent("onclick", _gaLt) });
